definition[0]: a piece of paper with a price on it that is attached to something in a shop
example[0]: It’s difficult to put a price tag on such a project  (=say how much it costs).
definition[2]: a small ticket showing the price of something
example[1]: There’s no price tag on this printer.
definition[3]: used to talk about the price of something, especially when this is very high
example[2]: a project that could have a price tag in excess of $100 million
example[3]: The governmentput a price tag of (=said the price would be) more than £2 billion on the shares it is privatizing in National Power PLC.
